import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Remove 'Id' from both train and test
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
numerical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
categorical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')

# Prepare data for pipeline
X_train_processed = pd.DataFrame(
    numerical_imputer.fit_transform(X_train[numerical_columns]),
    columns=numerical_columns
)
X_test_processed = pd.DataFrame(
    numerical_imputer.transform(X_test[numerical_columns]),
    columns=numerical_columns
)

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train[categorical_columns], drop_first=True)
X_train_processed = pd.concat([X_train_processed, categorical_encoded], axis=1)

categorical_encoded_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test[categorical_columns], drop_first=True)
X_test_processed = pd.concat([X_test_processed, categorical_encoded_test], axis=1)

# Ensure alignment of columns between train and test
X_train_processed = X_train_processed.reindex(columns=X_train_processed.columns, fill_val

import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor

from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Remove 'Id' from both train and test
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median())
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())

X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])
X_test[categorical_columns] = X_test[categorical_columns].fillna(X_test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Ensure column alignment
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Train model
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, train_df[target])

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print("Submission saved to submission.csv")

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Remove 'Id' from both train and test
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
for col in numerical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].median())
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].median())

for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(X_train[col].mode().iloc[0])
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(X_test[col].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Ensure column alignment
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Train model
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, train_df[target])

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print("Submission saved to submission.csv")
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Remove 'Id' from both train and test
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median())
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())

X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])
X_test[categorical_columns] = X_test[categorical_columns].fillna(X_test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Ensure column alignment
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Train model
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, train_df[target])

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print("Submission saved to submission.csv")

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include='object').columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Remove 'Id' from both train and test
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median())
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())

for col in categorical_columns:
    mode_value = X_train[col].mode()
    if len(mode_value) > 0:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(mode_value.iloc[0])
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(mode_value.iloc[0])
    else:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown')
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown')

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Ensure column alignment
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Train model
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, train_df[target])

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print("Submission

import pandas as pd

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include='object').columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['number']).columns.tolist()

# Remove 'Id' from both train and test
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median())
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())

for col in categorical_columns:
    mode_value = X_train[col].mode()
    if len(mode_value) > 0:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(mode_value.iloc[0])
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(mode_value.iloc[0])
    else:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown')
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown')

# One-hot encode categorical features
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Ensure column alignment
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Train model
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, train_df[target])

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_predictions
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print("Submission saved to submission.
